Header.title: Excellent Public Schools For All Children
Header.paragraph: Our Mission: to promote a standard of excellence for charter schools based on the principles of Scholarship, Transparency, Accountability, and Responsibility.

About.paragraph: STAR Schools is an organization for education reform created by the educators themselves. Our board of directors, all of whom who have had previous professional education experience, are at the forefront of education reform. We hire professionals and work with volunteers to help deliver the STAR message.
Why: STAR demonstrates the same financial accountability, transparency, and sound business that it expects from authorizers.
STAR receives funding from various foundations who share our commitment to improving education for all children and producing quality charter schools.
STAR also accepts individual donations, grants, and donations raised by community fundraisers.

Goals.name: Students First
Goals.text: Charter schools should be closed when they fail to meet performance standards or do not uphold the interest of students and the public.

Goals.name: Accountable Authorizers
Goals.text: Charter school authorizers should be held accountable for the school’s performance; Authorizers who have bad practices or are running failing schools should face consequences.

Goals.name: Transparency
Goals.text: All charter schools should require authorizers to report on the performance of its schools.

Goals.name: Financial Accountability
Goals.text: Charter schools should be transparent in their financial actions, especially when run by for-profits, and held accountable by the government when public funds are used irresponsibly.

Goals.name: High Standards
Goals.text: All charter schools should not be exempt from the state’s or school district’s established rules or laws.

Goals.name: Equal Access
Goals.text: Charter schools should be required to ensure equitable access to all children.

Principles.title: Scholarship
Principles.text: Every child deserve an excellent education with opportunities to learn and grow.

Principles.title: Transparency
Principles.text: All publicly funded schools should be run by organizations that are open and transparent.

Principles.title: Accountability
Principles.text: All public schools should be held accountable to the same high standards.

Principles.title: Responsibility
Principles.text: Public funding must be used effectively to benefit students and faculty fairly.
